hackathon-description-text: You'll work on a team alongside Apple engineers to create an iOS app. Join us at these sessions to meet Apple engineers and recruiters.
hackathon-eligibility: Registration is restricted to currently enrolled (as of January 25, 2016) students of the Rochester Institute of Technology.  If you have any questions, please e-mail
hackathon-requirements: Submit a project directory, including a working .xcodeproj with all supporting files, zipped up, to DevPost with your submission before the deadline.  A logo or icon representing your app is also required as part of the submission.  Your app will be compiled on our computers and pre-installed on an iPod touch, iPad, or iPhone 6S Plus for the final awards ceremony.  Make sure to specify which device you would like to use when you submit.
hackathon-rules:
The iOS Apps that are developed and submitted must meet these requirements in order to be eligible to win the contest and are subject to verification by the sponsoring organization:
The students that create the app will maintain full ownership rights although the code must be submitted to the challenge organizers to verify that it meets eligibility requirements and to pre-load it on an iPod touch, iPad, or iPhone 6S Plus for the demo presentation.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: iPad Pro Wi-Fi 128GB with Apple Pencil for each team member (up to 3).  Prize value $3,144.
Apple Watch 42mm Stainless Steel Case with White Sport Band for each team member (up to 3).  Prize value $1,797.
Apple TV for each team member (up to 3). Prize Value $597.
Apple TV for each team member (up to 3).  Prize Value $597.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Welcome Center, 1 Lomb Memorial Dr, Rochester, NY 14623, USA
hackathon-location-address: Welcome Center, 1 Lomb Memorial Dr, Rochester, NY 14623, USA
hackathon-description-header: Learn Swift and compete in a four-day code challenge.
